wikipedia_page.main: John "Jack" Holloway (9 December 1878 – 15 October 1950) was an Irish athlete. He participated in the men's all-around (a forerunner to the modern decathlon) at the 1904 Summer Olympics, placing fourth.

response: *John Holloway (Virginia politician) (1666–1734), mayor of Williamsburg, Virginia, 1722–1723
*John Holloway (Royal Navy officer) (1744–1826), British colonial official and governor of Newfoundland, 1807–1809
*John Holloway (botanist) (1881–1945), New Zealand Anglican priest, botanist and university lecturer

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1904 Summer Olympics
response: John Holloway had emigrated from Bansha to the U.S. some years previously and, like Kiely, wore a green singlet with a shamrock while competing. Holloway is counted as British by some statistics, whereas the Irish Whales (who represented U.S. clubs) are counted as American.
:*John Holloway (botanist) (1881–1945), New Zealand Anglican priest, botanist
:*John Holloway (Royal Navy officer) (1744–1826), British governor of Newfoundland
:*John Holloway (Virginia politician) (1666–1734), mayor of Williamsburg, Virginia
